result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Scott Warren Opheim was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott Warren Opheim is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Scott Warren Opheim was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Scott Warren Opheim was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Concurrent.
Count 3 dismissed.
Defendant to sign up for Probation by end of day June 5, 2014.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
Bond to apply and any balance refunded to payor.
DNA surcharge waived.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA Evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Signed by EJL on 06-07-2017. hml
c: DA
Paper file also retained. km
Reason for Change: Terminated - Regular.                      Restitution = $0.00, Court Obs = $0.00 and Supv fees $0.00. eif
balance to Gary Opheim ck# 023665 sent this date. eif
c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & E: Probation. eif
Assessment report. eif
Count 1 - all parties signed this date. c: DA. eif
Amended filed by ADA Amber Hahn. eif

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY:  Jeffrey L Kemp,  DF:  Scott Warren Opheim appeared. State files an amended information. There is an agreement. Court reviews consequences of felony conviction. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Count one is amended to 961.41(3g)(g) possession of meth - Class I felony. Court reads charge and possible penalties for counts 1, 4 and 5. Def pleads guilty to all counts. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of counts 4 (poss of drug para, misdemeanor) and 5 (Poss of cont. substance, misdemeanor). Count 3 is dismissed. Court stays adjudication of count 1 pending full performance of DJOC. 
Sentence in counts 4 and 5 - S/W 2 years probation, concurrent: Probation may be transferred to Minnesota
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA evaluation and follow through
- Court costs of $243.00 for each count. (Total is $486.00). Use money on file and return bond to payor. 
Defendant to sign up for probation by end of day June 5, 2014. 
Defendant is advised of right to appeal. 
Court reviews Deferred Judgment of Conviction - 3 year agreement. No court costs ordered. Defendant to pay costs of agreement, if any. Court approves, orders and signs agreement. Bond is amended and continues, as amended.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 4, 2014 at 04:00 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY:  Jeffrey L Kemp, DF:  Scott Warren Opheim did not appear. Atty Kemp states that def is incarcerated in MN. He is expected to be released in mid-May. ADA Hahn requests a date after that. STAY WARRANT until next date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Sharon Ann Correll, DF ATTY:  Jeffrey L. Kemp, DF:  Scott Warren Opheim did not appear. Def is incarcerated at Scott County Jail. MN may be revoking him due to his offense here. MN may be waiting for the outcome here before revoking him there. Court sets out 60 days. Court issues WARRANT - STAYED until 5/5/14 at 1:30 pm. sf  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
filed by ADA Hahn. kjf
filed by ADA Hahn.kjf
14SW38 (copy) is filed in 14CF52. ks
filed by Atty. Kemp.kjf
Gary Opheim  14R 001856. eif
Pre-trial conference on March 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.

*AMENDED*    Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
*Must reside with parents ( Gary and Roberta Opheim) at 2650 Skyview Court, Stillwater, MN 55082 OR a treatment program/jail. While residing with parents defendant to report every Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00 pm to the St Croix County Jail for testing at defendants expense. It is noted that defendant will test today (2/7/14) for Saturday's (2/8/14) test and continue every Wednesday and Saturday thereafter. 
*Sign a prewaiver of extradition form
*It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Joseph L.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Cory Crandall, Clerk: Fox, ADA: Amber Hahn, DF ATTY:  Jeffrey Kemp   DF:  Scott Warren Opheim appeared from jail. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. sf  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.
filed by Liesl Nelson; hereby appointing atty Jeffrey Kemp. sf
Preliminary hearing on February 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.


-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Joseph L.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  John A Kucinski,  DF:  Scott Warren Opheim appeared from jail. Defendant does qualify for PD.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Prelim is demanded. Defendant's parents are present (Gary Opheim). Request speedy prelim.
